title.narrative: Lesotho COVID-19 Emergency Preparedness and Response Project

description.narrative: To prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 to the Kingdom of Lesotho.

condition.narrative: By no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall recruit and/or retain a technical expert in vaccinelogistics/deployment under terms of reference and with qualifications and experience acceptable to the Association.

Project Implementation ManualThe Recipient shall: (a) by no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, prepare and adopta Project implementation manual (“Project Implementation Manual”) containing detailed guidelines and procedures for theimplementation of the Project in form and substance satisfactory to the Association; and (b) except as the Bank shall otherwiseagree in writing; not amend or waive or permit to be amended or waived any provision of the Project Implementation Manual.

title.narrative: Diagnosed cases treated per approved protocol
Grievances addressed on time (as specified in the Stakeholder Engagement Plan)
COVID-19 PCR tests processed within two days
Health staff trained in COVID-19 case management per MOH-approved protocols
Doses of eligible COVID-19 vaccines procured
Female health staff trained in COVID-19 vaccination deployment per MOH-approved protocols
Health staff trained in COVID-19 vaccination deployment per MOH-approved protocols
COVID-19 related information and education sessions targeting women
Male health staff trained in COVID-19 vaccination deployment per MOH-approved protocols
Serious AEFI after COVID-19 vaccination investigated
A patient feedback mechanism for COVID-19 vaccinations is in place and functional
National Reference Laboratory is expanded, equipped and functional
